alert.note: Alert for Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 11 at 5:38PM EDT until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by runoff from recent excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Along the Neuse river near Seven Springs in Wayne County, North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The Neuse River may come out of its banks, potentially flooding boat ramps, and low-lying and flood-prone locations. The river continues to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 531 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly along the Neuse River from Cliffs Of The Neuse State Park to Seven Springs. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Seven Springs and Cliffs Of The Neuse State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks can become unstable and unsafe. Be especially cautious at night.
